page.title: 11EDUCATION IN HUDDERSFIELD
page.content: Kayes' College conducted a survey on education in area, which ranges from Secondary and Junior schools, to schools which cater for children with both mental and physical disabilities HollyBank school is one example; the emphasis is placed on a basic education, which gives domestic and communicative skills, Highfields Special School is another example. Centres for Adult and Further Education include the Adult Literacy Unit in Marsh, which runs courses in English as a Second Language and is the Headquarters of Huddersfield Night School and the Open University. The HollyBank Teachers Training Centre enables qualified students to become teachers in different fields of education. Banney Royd Teachers Centre has 'In Service' Courses for all teachers.
